reviews.text: The Buck inn is a traditional country pub & Inn that is set in the idyllic village of Thornton Watless. We stayed in the downstairs family room which was clean and spacious. The room has traditional country furniture (one double bed and two singles), it is very comfortable although the random 70's style chairs could go the distance, it also has an excellent hospitality tray with Fairtrade tea and coffee, hot chocolate and a range of biscuits (better than you get in many 4* hotels). The bathroom is large with a shower and bath, also you can tell the owners have thought about providing an excellent service by adding toiletries and handy little accessories such as sowing kits and shoe shine. The pub it self is full of character, and features a welcoming open fire. You can choose to have your meals in the dining room which is where a great English breakfast is served (love the fact they have bean to cup coffee) or for lunch dinner you can choose to sit in the bar, which I would recommend as it is full of fun with friendly locals on an evening. The owners and lady behind the bar could not be more friendly and welcoming, and if you have a child don't worry about them not being welcome in the bar area because this would be far from the truth, my five year old had a wonderful time. The Village it self is very quiet and the inn sits on one side of a cricket pitch which is at the centre of village life in the summer, there are no other services in the village however Bedale is about 2 miles away which has every service you need and is worth a visit to look around the shops. The only areas for improvement I would suggest are cosmetic, it would be good to give the room doors a lick of paint, and the exterior of the building - particularly the windows could do with some attention, however these were minor and would certainly not put me off recommending this inn to anyone who is looking for an excellent experience in a great English Inn.
reviews.title: Nice B&B - Fantastic Country Inn

reviews.text: This is a great Inn for a quiet drink or a great choice of bar meals.I was a guest at a family party and we had a great time.Brilliant entertainment and a well varied and substantial buffet.It has a welcoming Inn Keeper and attentive staff.This is a perfect venue for parties,get togethers and conferences.I recommend this Inn to all who are looking for quality and character,with good food.
reviews.title: A place with character and characters

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have lived in the area for 11 years now and have struggled to find a country pub with restaurant rather than a restaurant with a bar within easy reach. I think we have found it. Really pleasant bar with friendly regulars. Stayed for Sunday lunch last week and by accident this coincided with the Sunday Jazz session. The Roast Beef dinner was excellent - couldn't fault it. The landlord and his staff are extremely friendly and welcoming. I think we may become "regulars" ourselves!!!!
reviews.title: Great Sunday Lunch

reviews.text: Lovely, homely country pub with great beers. We ate twice on consecutive nights. We asked for the medium fish and chips. It was a huge plateful. Batter crisp and light. Chips totally delicious - what I call proper fish and chips. The next night I had a chicken curry with poppadoms and sauce. Really good value for excellent food. Cannot wait to go again. If you want a weekend away from it all where you can just stagger up to bed after a good meal and a pint or two this is the place. Oh and the breakfast hit the same high standards. Perfect porridge and properly made scrambled eggs.
reviews.title: Best fish and chips ever

reviews.text: My family have stayed at the Buck every year at October half term since 1997, when our son was 4. Every time as we sit in the bar on the first night, we can feel ourselves relaxing.....we love the Buck. Excellent meals always, excellent and friendly service, good ales, beautiful setting overlooking the cricket pitch. You will not get a city-type hotel experience here. What you will get is a very friendly country pub, immaculately clean rooms (I have a dust allergy but have no problems in the morning with the Buck) and excellent meals. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Lovely, relaxing country pub

reviews.text: The hotel is somewhat isolated in a small village and is a good choice for a short one night stopover. However, If you want shopping or other activities this may not be the place for you. The service is friendly and the food and real ales in the small pub are excellent.
reviews.title: Not bad for the price.

reviews.text: After looking at a few different country inns with valentines meals on offer we decided on The Buck Inn. We were combining valentines with our little girls 2nd birthday, so after spending a couple of hours in the afternoon at a wacky warehouse party with her little friends we wanted to escape to the country for a valentines stop over. So as a couple with our little girl and my parents in tow we headed off to Thornton Watlass.
reviews.title: Valentines stop over and 2nd birthday of daughter
